ig_package

Package for easily using IG Group’s API.

Created on Tuesday 12th March 2024. @author: Harry New

Submodules

  • ig_package.main

Package Contents

Classes

IG

Object to interact with IG Group's API.

Watchlist

Object representing IG Group API's watchlist.

Instrument

Object representing a single instrument from IG API.
class ig_package.IG(API_key: str, username: str, password: str, watchlist_enable: bool = False)
Object to interact with IG Group’s API.

  • Open trading sessions.

  • Get historical data.

  • Close trading sessions.

**NOTE: API key, username and password should be entered when initialising the IG object.

open_trading_session() → bool

Opens a IG Group trading session.

Returns:

Boolean if response was successful or not.

Return type:

bool

open_streaming_session() → None

Opening a streaming session through IG, allowing data to be collected in real time.

check_trading_session() → bool

Checking if trading session active.

Returns:

Boolean depending if trading session is open or not.

Return type:

bool

_get_watchlists_from_IG() → dict | None

Getting all watchlists associated with the API key. Watchlists are directly from IG.

Returns:

Dictionary of IG watchlists.

Return type:

dict

_get_watchlist_objs() → list[Watchlist] | None

Getting watchlists within IG Obj directly from IG API.

Returns:

List of Watchlist objects.

Return type:

list[Watchlist]

_get_watchlist_from_IG(name: str = None, id: str = None) → dict | None

Getting a singular watchlist associated with the API key. Watchlist is directly from IG.

Parameters:

  • name (str = None (OPTIONAL)) – Name of the watchlist.

  • id (str = None (OPTIONAL)) – ID of the watchlist.

Returns:

Dictionary of IG watchlist.

Return type:

dict

_get_watchlist_obj(name: str = None, id: str = None) → Watchlist | None

Getting a singular Watchlist object.

Parameters:

  • name (str = None (OPTIONAL)) – Name of the watchlist.

  • id (str = None (OPTIONAL)) – ID of the watchlist.

Returns:

Watchlist with corresponding name or id.

Return type:

Watchlist

add_watchlist(name: str) → Watchlist | None

Adding watchlist associated to relevant API key. *NOTE: IG object must have watchlist enabled to use this.*

Parameters:

name (str) – Name of the watchlist to be created.

Returns:

Watchlist object created.

Return type:

Watchlist

del_watchlist(name: str = None, id: str = None) → Watchlist | None

Deleting watchlist associated to relevant API key. *NOTE: IG object must have watchlist enabled to use this.*

Parameters:

  • name (str=None (OPTIONAL)) – Name of the watchlist to be deleted.

  • id (str=None (OPTIONAL)) – ID of the watchlist to be deleted.

Returns:

Wacthlist object that was deleted.

Return type:

Watchlist

search_instrument(name: str) → Instrument | None

Search for instrument. Gets the closest instrument to the inputted string.

Parameters:

name (str) – Name of instrument to be searched for.

Returns:

Instrument object of the top match to the inputted string.

Return type:

Instrument

class ig_package.Watchlist(id: str, IG_obj: IG)

Object representing IG Group API’s watchlist. - Holds a series of financial instruments. - Can be used to get historical data for all.

_get_instruments_IG() → list | None

Getting financial instruments held within the watchlist from the IG API.

Returns:

List of markets stored within watchlist.

Return type:

list

_get_instrument_objects() → list

Getting instrument objects of all instruments within the watchlist.

Returns:

List of Instrument objects within Watchlist.

Return type:

list

_get_instrument(name: str = None, epic: str = None) → dict | None

Gets instrument by name or epic.

Parameters:

  • name (str=None (OPTIONAL)) – Name of the Instrument.

  • epic (str=None (OPTIONAL)) – Epic of the Instrument.

Returns:

Dictionary with relevant instrument information.

Return type:

dict

add_instrument(instrument_name: str) → str

Adding instrument to watchlist. Updates watchlist markets attribute.

Parameters:

instrument_name (str) – Name of instrument to be added.

Returns:

Instrument epic.

Return type:

str

del_instrument(instrument_name: str = None, epic: str = None) → None

Deleting instrument from watchlist. Takes instrument name and searches watchlist for it. Updates watchlist markets attribute.

Parameters:

  • instrument_name (str=None (OPTIONAL)) – Name of instrument to be deleted.

  • epic (str=None (OPTIONAL)) – Epic of instrument to be deleted.

get_all_historical_data(resolution: str, start: str, end: str) → dict

Gets all historical data from instruments contained within the watchlist.

Parameters:

  • resolution (str) – Resolution of the historical data e.g. SECOND, MINUTE, MINUTE_2, MINUTE_3, MINUTE_5, MINUTE_10, MINUTE_15, MINUTE_30, HOUR, HOUR_2, HOUR_3, HOUR_4, DAY, WEEK, MONTH.

  • start (str) – Start date of historical data e.g. “YYYY:MM:DD-HH:mm:ss”.

  • end (str) – End date of historical data e.g. “YYYY:MM:DD-HH:mm:ss”.

Returns:

Dictionary of all dataframes with the key being the instrument name.

Return type:

dict

class ig_package.Instrument(epic: str, IG_obj: IG)

Object representing a single instrument from IG API. - Allows for collection of historical data.

get_historical_prices(resolution: str, start: str, end: str) → pandas.DataFrame | None

Getting historical price data for the instrument from IG API.

Parameters:

  • resolution (str) – Resolution of the historical data e.g. SECOND, MINUTE, MINUTE_2, MINUTE_3, MINUTE_5, MINUTE_10, MINUTE_15, MINUTE_30, HOUR, HOUR_2, HOUR_3, HOUR_4, DAY, WEEK, MONTH.

  • start (str) – Start date of historical data e.g. “YYYY:MM:DD-HH:mm:ss”.

  • end (str) – End date of historical data e.g. “YYYY:MM:DD-HH:mm:ss”.

Returns:

Dataframe containing Date (INDEX), Open, High, Low and Close data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

start_live_data() → None

Starting the live data ticker throught the lightstreamer_client.
